result.execSummary:
The defendant Jed N. Fiers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due, and/or other collection means, such as income assignment will be issued.  The Defendant is to complete AODA assessment and comply with any treatment recommended.  The Defendant is to undergo any counseling the agent finds appropriate and must comply with any recommended treatment/assessment/counseling.  Defendant may not withdraw from any ordered program without permission of the agent and/or provider.  The Defendant is to obtain and maintain full time employment and/or educational programming as recommended.  The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or drugs unless prescribed by a physician.  Defendant is subject to random drug/UA/breath testing.  The Defendant is not to go into any bars, taverns or businesses where the primary purpose is to sell alcohol.  The Defendant is to write letters of apology to his dad and to the officer, in his own handwriting, minimum of 100 words, to be given to Agent within 10 days.  Defendant is to be drug tested prior to probation review hearing on 6/24/16 @ 11am.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jed N. Fiers

to Lift Stay of Condition of Probation; approved as requested

Not Guilty plea entered - Jury dates given
Atty requested - further proceedings scheduled in Court Commissioner - dean paperwork given

The defendant shall appear on all court dates; give written notice to the Clerk of Court  within 48 hours of any change of address or telephone number;  shall not commit any crime; shall neither directly nor indirectly threaten, harass, intimidate or otherwise interfere with victims or witnesses in this action.
Call the Outagamie County Sheriff's Dept. at (920) 832-5633 within 48 hours for fingerprints and/or photos.  The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or drugs unless prescribed by a physician.
Deft appears while in custody. Further proceedings set.
